Instruction: This corned beef brisket is a delicious option for any occasion, from holidays to everyday dinners. You'll want to save this highly-rated recipe, as it's sure to become a favorite in your meal rotation.
This corned beef recipe entails searing the beef brisket in a hot skillet and braising it with garlic and onions for an exceptional tender, flavorful meat.
Find the detailed recipe guide below, and here's a brief overview of what to anticipate when preparing this highly rated corned beef brisket.

Brush the entire brisket with browning sauce, then sear it on both sides in a hot skillet with vegetable oil. Transfer it to a roasting pan with a rack. Sprinkle onions and garlic slices on top of the brisket. Pour water into the pan, cover it tightly with foil, and roast in the oven until the meat reaches a tender consistency.

Let the corned beef brisket cool down before storing. Keep any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to four days. When reheating, cover it with foil and warm it in the oven.

You can freeze leftover cooked corned beef brisket for later use by wrapping the cooled portions in freezer wrap and foil, then freezing them for up to three months. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.

Heat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).
Brush both sides of the corned beef brisket with browning sauce, discarding any flavoring packet.
Brown the brisket in a hot skillet with vegetable oil, cooking on each side for around 5 to 8 minutes.
Place the brisket on a rack inside a roasting pan, sprinkle onion and garlic slices over the brisket, and pour water into the pan. Cover the pan tightly with aluminum foil.
Roast in the oven until the meat is tender, typically around 6 hours in total.
Serve the dish hot and appreciate the flavors!
